meanings.definition: The fused head and thorax of an arachnid.
meanings.sent1: The cephalthoraxes of the spider help it to sense its surroundings.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the cephalthoraxes of the scorpion under a microscope.
meanings.sent3: The spider wearing tiny glasses on its cephalthoraxes looked quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The cephalthoraxes of the scorpion were like a protective shield.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the cephalthoraxes was truly fascinating.

meanings.definition: The front part of the body of a crustacean, consisting of the head and thorax fused together.
meanings.sent1: The lobster's cephalthoraxes provide protection from predators.
meanings.sent2: The crab's cephalthoraxes allow it to move swiftly in the water.
meanings.sent3: The shrimp with a top hat on its cephalthoraxes looked quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The cephalthoraxes of the lobster were as tough as armor.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors of the cephalthoraxes stood out against the ocean floor.
